title: Neon Rain
excerpt: The city breathes in Technicolor gasps, reflected in puddles of oil and regret...
body:
The city breathes in Technicolor gasps,
Reflected in puddles of oil and regret.
We run for cover,
Not from the water,
But from the truth it washes bare.

Static hums in the wires above,
A lullaby for the restless,
While the traffic lights blink red,
Stop. Stop. Stop.
But we keep moving.
